summary: An educational podcast focused on introducing the fundamental concepts of genetics, including traits, DNA, genes, and alleles.

events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker who is explaining genetics. He defines and describes "genes," "alleles," and "DNA," using a clear and educational tone. He notes that "DNA is the hereditary information" and an allele is one of the two genes in a pair. The speaker encourages the listener to pause and relisten if he is talking too quickly. He goes on to say that alleles can be "dominant or recessive."

events_list.audio_caption: An male speaker defines dominant and recessive alleles, explaining how dominant alleles "show its trait whenever present", using the example of dark hair as a dominant trait. He discusses how recessive traits require two alleles to be shown and draws chromosomes to illustrate these genetic concepts. The speaker maintains an informative tone.
